basics.name: Jonathan Ho
basics.label: Web Developer
basics.summary: Front-End Developer with Back-End proficiency with strong background in Computer Science and Information Technology. Specialties include: Node.js, AngularJS and MVC Frameworks; REST API development and integration; and Cross-Browser/Platform, Mobile-Friendly, Responsive Web Design. Sociable and detail-oriented team player with a passion for continuous learning and self-improvement. Values business and interpersonal relationships; enjoys the challenge of exploring the potential of new technologies.  Likes people.  Allergic to cats.
basics.subtitle: New York NY

education.institution: Rutgers, the State University of New Jersey
education.summary: Completed three semesters towards a B.A. in History
Completed five semesters in Engineering and Computer Science

projects.name: Paper Résumé
projects.summary: Front-End Web Developer portfolio and résumé web application to present JSON data
highlights: Developed AngularJS project to present résumé content and showcase Front-End Web Developer skills and qualifications
Tailored rich UI/UX components with HTML5 and Scss stylesheets to comply with Google's Material Design specification
Optimised web performance with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript minification and image compression

projects.name: poppyGP Player
projects.summary: Single-page JavaScript application built around a 24/7 video stream channel and IRC webchat for Reddit Formula 1 racing enthusiasts' community
highlights: Designed and developed a fully-responsive, cross-platform, cross-browser, mobile and tablet-friendly front-end Angular video application
Maintained back- and front-end interfaces, gaining continuous increases in frequency, duration, and geographic scope of visits
Alleviated sudden and overwhelming 400% spike in traffic by configuring and launching an AWS EC2 instance, and maintained consistency of service while performing migration from previous webhost

projects.name: GPQuery
projects.summary: Statistical analysis and data visualisation web application for Grand Prix Racing records since 1950
highlights: Integrated D3.js data visualisation library with AngularJS to render dynamic graphical representations of data
Developed data services with Angular-Resource to retrieve data via HTTP requests to RESTful services for JSON-encoded responses
Streamlined workflow with Gulp and Browser-Sync to automate testing and build tasks with a local development environment
